body: I have the error message for a very simple 3-zone geometry from the readme output of a mass2zones component. May I ask if this warning is critical? [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/bAnmdOW7NagC1GsDbkXp6xARrXezgzLpN*wJHRE7ZTEcLpcQuIcqu*aM5m4Fky7ek8e*K2-b2*gX8NHkUGGzCh*yqQrEEHAc/04.PNG)
topic: [error] Honeybee cannot check normal directions for zone_A

replies.body:
This is a warning that usually happens if you have a non-convex shape and center point falls outside of geometry. In general if the normal direction is already set correctly then you shouldn't be worried about it. In the image all the shapes look like simple boxes so you shouldn't normally see the warning. I will check your file and report back.

Mostapha

It looks like a Grasshopper/RhinoCommon bug to me. For some reason Grasshopper thinks center point of your first box is not inside the box! [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/lihD20i2jryyL6mpD7m8fwEXEeuQ9oKkqvJRY3QU3dL-zGpzOsLxA-DgrRsxOBnCQJrPwp0VHi0rCe5mboeoCI0deno4jP0Y/isCenterPtInside.png) I reported this bug while ago and nobody ever replied ([http://www.grasshopper3d.com/forum/topics/bug-inclusiontest-fails-i...](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/forum/topics/bug-inclusiontest-fails-in-rhinocommon-and-grasshopper)). You may want to refresh the post. There is also a chance that I'm making an obvious mistake!
